rvinecopulib
  • Reference

High Performance Algorithms for Vine Copula Modeling

High Performance Algorithms for Vine Copula Modeling

Examples

# bivariate copula
dist <- bicop_dist("clayton", 90, 3)
u <- rbicop(100, dist)
fit <- bicop(u)
fit
#> Bivariate copula fit ('bicop'): family = clayton, rotation = 90, parameters = 2.700757
#> nobs = 100   logLik = 63.12   npars = 1   AIC = -124.24   BIC = -121.63   
summary(fit)
#>            Length Class  Mode     
#> family       1    -none- character
#> rotation     1    -none- numeric  
#> parameters   1    -none- numeric  
#> npars        1    -none- numeric  
#> data       200    -none- numeric  
#> controls     6    -none- list     
#> nobs         1    -none- numeric  

# vine copula
u <- sapply(1:3, function(i) runif(50))
fit <- vinecop(u, "par")
fit
#> 3-dimensional vine copula model fit
#> nobs = 50   logLik = 0   npars = 0   AIC = 0   BIC = 0   
summary(fit)
#> 3-dimensional vine copula model fit
#> nobs = 50   logLik = 0   npars = 0   AIC = 0   BIC = 0   
#> ----
#>  tree edge conditioned conditioning family rotation parameters
#>     1    1        3, 1               indep        0           
#>     1    2        2, 1               indep        0           
#>     2    1        3, 2            1  indep        0
